title: Add top-level README.md for DarkPattern Shield project

requirements.text: Create a top-level `README.md` at the repository root that documents the DarkPattern Shield project in English, including: project overview, key features/pages, tech stack, prerequisites, local development setup (frontend + IC canister), how authentication works (Internet Identity), and how to export/download the full source code using the existing export scripts and docs.

quotes: povide a readme file of this project

acceptanceCriteria: A `README.md` file exists at the repository root (same level as `backend/` and `frontend/`).
README content is entirely English and written as end-user/developer documentation (not internal notes).

README includes (at minimum) sections for: Overview, Features (with the existing pages: Home, Subscription Trap Detector, Personal Digital Risk Test, Scam Reporting + Dashboard, Browser Extension Concept), Tech Stack, Prerequisites (Node/pnpm/dfx), Local Development (install deps, run frontend, deploy canisters), Authentication (Internet Identity high-level flow), and Source Code Export (pointing to the existing `frontend/SOURCE_CODE_EXPORT.md` and mentioning the scripts in `frontend/scripts/`).
README does not introduce any new product features beyond what is already implemented.

README instructions align with the existing export behavior described by `frontend/SOURCE_CODE_EXPORT.md` and `frontend/scripts/export-source-code.sh` (including the `README_EXPORT.md` naming inside the export archive).

constraints: Do not modify files under `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, or anything in `frontend/src/components/ui`.
Keep all backend logic in the existing single Motoko actor (no new backend services).
nonGoals: Do not add a new in-app Tech Stack page unless explicitly requested.
Do not change authentication behavior or add new sign-up/login UI beyond what already exists.
Do not change the export scriptsâ€™ archive format/behavior beyond updating documentation references if needed.
